info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 25 at 11:59PM MST until December 27 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...SIGNIFICANT TRAVEL IMPACTS EXPECTED WITH QUICK HITTING STORM SUNDAY... .A fast moving storm system will bring hazardous travel conditions to the mountains on Sunday. Snow will develop late tonight and Sunday morning, and may then become heavy at times by early afternoon Sunday. Strong winds and considerable blowing snow will combine with the falling snow to produce blizzard or near blizzard conditions at times early to mid afternoon Sunday. Road closures will be possible. Snow will decrease by late afternoon or early evening, but slick roads, lighter snow, and areas of blowing snow will continue through Sunday night. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow. Snow accumulations between 7 and 14 inches, with higher amounts north of Rabbit Ears Pass. Winds gusting between 45 and 65 mph creating near blizzard conditions. * WHERE...Rabbit Ears Pass. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible, especially during the day Sunday.
info.instruction: Consider avoiding travel over Rabbit Ears Pass on Sunday. If you do travel, drive with extreme caution. Consider taking a winter storm kit along with you, including such items as tire chains, booster cables, flashlight, shovel, blankets and extra clothing. Also take water, a first aid kit, and anything else that would help you survive in case you become stranded. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org.
